name: Cameroon Boyo Coffee
description:
We, the farmers of Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee, believe that our customers and consumers SHOULD NOT be penalized with high prices because of certifications. We have therefore chosen TOTAL TRANSPARENCY as one of the basic attributes of our trade process. We invite industry professionals to visit us and verify our practices to their satisfaction. This approach has built CONFIDENCE and especially TRUST.

We, the farmers of Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee remain the owners of our coffee as it travels to market. We grow coffee to afford us the means to cover the costs of feeding, housing, health care and education of our children – these are basic rights that ensure our human dignity. The price we ask for our coffee also ensures that our collaborating partners are adequately and equitably compensated. The More Than Fair™ certification is your assurance that we are living up to these ideals without penalizing the consumers of our coffee. (see www.morethanfair.org)
Direct Trade
Small Farmer Grown™
Small Farmer Owned™
we do not have large “plantations”; close to 100% of our coffee is produced in small holder family farms by family members.
 we are the owners of the Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee, even after it has left our hands. Every export bag is stamped with our seal to testify to that
Collaborative Trade
Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee does not undergo the multiple buying and selling transactions that typically move coffee along the supply chain. Instead, individuals and entities collaborate, each fulfilling the specific function (milling, transportation, warehousing) necessary to move the coffee to the final point of sale, while ensuring that the producing farmers retain ownership interests in it.
Organic and Holistic
Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee is grown in family farms, alongside other important family food crops. Our farmers practice traditional farming techniques developed over many generations. Even though in the region where our villages are located, use of chemical fertilizers and sprays is very rare (for a variety of reasons including cost, degradation of the taste of food, adverse effects on health), only farmers who strictly practice natural and organic farming are contributing to our batches of Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee. We believe that our “open doors” attitude and our commitment to be trustworthy partners to those who depend on us are what will ensure a strong and lasting supply chain. We will not jeopardize this privilege.
Authenticity
We have worked hard make the Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee brand special and unique.
Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee 
Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee
To ensure that our customers are receiving coffee grown and owned by our farmers, we have coded our batches of coffee in order to be able to trace back to the farmers who contributed to each batch, and all market partners (roasters, coffee shops and retail outlets) are required to identify the Cameroon Boyo™ Coffee brand on their packages.
Today, much effort is being made to address the question of poverty, especially in coffee producing regions around the world. One such approach is the so called “fair trade” certification process. One important question remains: “why, after all these years, does poverty still persist even in areas where fair trade is practiced?”

We are making a noticeable difference
Since Cameroon BOYO™ Coffee is owned by the producing farmers, sales proceeds directly reward them. Furthermore, to get the best market price, farmers understand that they have to deliver the best quality coffee. Consumers are not penalized with high “arbitrary” prices because of certification seals.
This collaborative approach to trade is More Than Fair
it is EARNED; farmers work hard, deliver top quality and so earn more
it is JUST, rewarding farmers enough to cater for their basic human needs before sharing of market gains with collaborators
it is FAIR TO ALL, farmers and collaborators share all market risks; consumers do not pay arbitarily high prices
it is EQUITABLE, rewarding collaborators in proportion to their contribution to the supply of coffee.
Cameroon BOYO™ Coffee: Small Farmer Grown™ Small Farmer Owned™

name: Nashis' Artistic Buna Blends
description:
Limited Exclusive Blends, That We Create In House, Using Two Or More Beans. Feel Free To Let Your Palate Explore The Infinite World Of Artisan Coffee Blending.


Tabac Kafie Maduro | A Celebration Of Buna For My BOTL, This Triple Bean Buna Was Designed For The Cigar Aficionado. Enjoy All Alone, Or With Your Favorite Cigar.

Kings Blends | A Combination Of 2 Bunas Exciting Enough For A Queen, But Crafted For The Kings! Celebrate The Kingdom. This Is An Exciting Brew!

Turkish Kahve |קפה טורקי | A Proprietary Blend Of Our Rare Buna, Ground To A Fine Powder, To Be Enjoyed With An Ibrik Pot.

name: Cush Buna Special Reserve Direct Farm Rare 6oz.
description:
Direct Relationship Micro-lot Coffees, Cup Of Excellence, Cush Certified Farm & Community Conscious & Superior Cup Quality.

Finca Kassandra Blue Mountain
This is the Blue Mountain varietal that is being grown near Vera Cruz, Mexico. Finca Kassandra are one of the few farms with permission to produce Blue Mountain outside of Jamaica, largely due to their almost identical growing and environmental conditions. UTZ & Rainforest Alliance Certified. Direct Trade / Relationship

Amaro Gayo Natural Sidama
Direct trade @ 3 x "Fair Trade" floor price. All Amaro Gayo coffee is certified organic. Prices paid for this coffee are at the extreme high end of market, social programs are in the works including possibilities for assistance with capacity building and coffee job creation, schools, clean water and medical care.

Kochere Yirgacheffe
Region: Southern Oromia, Yirgacheffe
Varietal: Heirloom
Processing: Washed and Patio Dried
Altitude: 1,900-2,000 
Harvested November 2011-January 2012
The Kochere District is located in Chalalacktu, a township located in the famous Yirgacheffe region. This area has some of the most sought out coffee in the region as 30% of the exported coffee in Yirgacheffe comes from the Kochere District. The Chalalacktu village has a population of about 100,000 that is primarily dependent on coffee as their main source of income.

Peru Femenino Chanchamayo 
http://cafefemenino.com/
Today, the Café Femenino Coffee Project is a social program for women coffee producers in rural communities around the world. More than 1,500 women in Bolivia, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Guatemala, Mexico and Peru are active in the project to achieve empowerment, build social and support networks, and earn incomes through the production and sale of the Café Femenino Coffee. The success of the Project initiated the creation of The Café Femenino Foundation, which provides grants to select programs and projects that enhance the lives of women and their families in coffee growing communities around the world

Dominican Republic Bani  Fair Trade, Organic Certified.

Tanzania Natural Peaberry Exclusive Microlot

Nicaragua SHG Strictly High Grown Cafe. Shade Grown Only 1% Of The Worlds Coffee Is SHG. Wet Processed, With Natural Spring Water, Grown At 1100 - 1200 Meters Above Sea Level.

name: CushCoffee 6oz.
description:
CushCoffees are among the highest quality coffees sourced consciously through either Direct Trade, Fair Trade, or More Than Fair certifications. All coffees are organic, whether certified or non certified. We believe in protecting our products, as well as those who consume them. Our coffees are extremely rare since we purchase very small lots of coffee from our groups of suppliers. We then artfully roast them to perfection. Our niche of custom roasting for clients is becoming popular among those seeking a new level in coffee tasting experience! Our coffee stock rotates often. Because we purchase small batches, you are guaranteed a new experience with every new purchase. Nano roasting & purchasing is an art within itself. By roasting small quantities, we can control the roasting processes more effectively. Also our purchasing small quantities guarantees diversity in the beans we roast because every purchased batch comes from a different lot or farm! How exciting is that for artisan crafting!
Direct-Farm Sumatera Red Badger
Name : Sumatra Red Badger TP Grade 1
Region	:	 Desa Kerawat – Takengon – Aceh – North Sumatra
Varietals	:	 Ateng, Typica, Djember
Elevation	:	 1350 – 1500 meter
Process	:	 Semi-Washed / Wet Hulled
Drying Process	:	 Sun Dried
“Coffees from the northern part of the Indonesian island of Sumatra are admired for their complex earth, fruit and aromatic wood notes that result largely from unorthodox fruit removal and drying practices called “wet hulling.” This coffee is a refined example of the type.

Blind Assessment: Sweetly and gently pungent. Peach, melon, cocoa, fir, a hint of grapefruity citrus in aroma and cup. Rich, balanced acidity; lightly syrupy mouth feel. Sweetly tart, citrusy finish.

Who should drink it: Non-gardening Sumatra drinkers. A still pungent but rather bright version of the classic Sumatra profile, with only a discreet hint of the usual musty earth.”
Adapted from www.coffeereview.com

Direct Farm Sumatera Mandheling
Name	:	 Semi Washed Sumatra Mandheling DP Grade 1
Region	:	 Mandheling – North Sumatra
Varietals	:	 Ateng, Bergendal and Djember
Elevation	:	 1100 – 1300 meter
Process	:	 Semi-Washed / Wet Hulled
Drying Process	:	 Sun-Dried

name: Shiny Digm Soap 5 oz.
description:
Our unique formula will gently, yet effectively, cleanse from head to toe without overdrying skin.
We use essential oils for their therapeutic benefits as well as their fragrances.

Bathe Yourself in LOVE, PEACE, and GRATITUDE

CALM
Gentle and soothing for irritated or sensitive skin, this soap contains calming chamomile flowers and oatmeal, but no essential oils.

LEMONGRACIAS
A revitalizing and stress relieving combination that is good for oily and acne prone skin. 

SERENITY
Lightly scented with a blend of patchouli and sweet orange essential oils to soothe irritated skin and uplift emotions.

LOVE IN THERE
Lavender tones and revitalizes irritated skin while calming the emotions. 

GRACE
Lightly scented with essential oils of grapefruit, lime, and may chang, this blend is said to be both calming and refreshing to the senses.

XIE SHEA
Made with 10% Shea Butter, this soap is very moisturizing and has a soothing scent of ylang ylang and rosemary.

ALL LOVE
A true Castille soap made exclusively with olive oil. All Love gently cleanses and moisturizes the skin.

BUNA BLESS YOU
This unique formula is infused with coffee that has been custom roasted by Barista On DutY.  It also contains finely ground beans to exfoliate and stimulate the skin

Every bar sold here comes with a pair of dimes (get it- paradigms) for you to use to make the world a little better.  Get creative – there are no limits to what you can do. Use it how you want to and come tell me about it@ http://shinydigm.wordpress.com.
